title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2202.6 - Increase in subtenants or occupants
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2202.6 - Increase in subtenants or occupants

State Regulations

The administrator may grant an appropriate adjustment of
a maximum rent where he finds that there has been, since March 1, 1959, a
subletting without written consent from the landlord or an increase in the
number of adult occupants who are not members of the immediate family of the
tenant, and the landlord has not been compensated therefor by adjustment of the
maximum rent by lease, or by order of the administrator, or pursuant to the

State Rent Act or the Federal Act. Such adjustment shall be effective only
during the period of subletting or increase in the number of
tenants. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2202.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
